title: Persistent love notes with post-Yes letter reveal and progressive floating notes

requirements.summary: Keep love notes visible before and after answering Yes via a persistent, mobile-friendly notes section.
acceptanceCriteria: Before any button is pressed, the proposal question and an initial set of love notes are visible.
After clicking/tapping Yes, the confirmation/success UI is shown AND love notes are still visible on the page (e.g., in a persistent section, sidebar, or below the main card), not replaced entirely.
Love notes remain readable on mobile without requiring horizontal scrolling.

file_operations.description: Refactor layout so an initial set of love notes remains visible in a persistent section both before and after the answered state (e.g., below the main card with responsive widths and wrapping). Use shadcn/ui Card composition (do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a centralized long-form love letter and reveal it only after Yes, preserving paragraphs and signature.
acceptanceCriteria: The full provided letter text is stored in the centralized content file (frontend/src/content/valentineCopy.ts) so it can be edited in one place.
The letter is not shown before answering; it becomes visible only after Yes is clicked/tapped.
The letter preserves paragraph breaks and includes the closing signature (‚ÄúYours, Aditya ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù) exactly as provided.
The letter section is mobile-friendly (comfortable line length, spacing, and scroll behavior if needed).

file_operations.description: Add the provided long-form love letter to centralized content (including the closing signature ‚ÄúYours, Aditya ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù exactly as provided) in a way that preserves paragraph breaks for rendering.

Render the love letter only after Yes is clicked, using formatting that preserves line breaks/paragraphs (e.g., whitespace-preserving rendering) and a readable, mobile-friendly letter container (comfortable max width, spacing, and vertical scrolling if needed). Use shadcn/ui Card composition (do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: After Yes, progressively reveal additional short love notes with gentle fade/float animations without external libraries.
acceptanceCriteria: A new set of short love notes (distinct from the initial set) is added to the centralized content (frontend/src/content/valentineCopy.ts).

After Yes is clicked/tapped, the UI progressively reveals multiple small note elements (e.g., one every few hundred milliseconds) with gentle animation (fade/slide/float) and does not require external libraries.
The small notes are readable and do not overlap critical content on common mobile viewport sizes; if space is limited they wrap/stack gracefully.
Refreshing the page resets the experience (pre-Yes view shown again) unless existing app behavior already persists state.

file_operations.description: Add a post-Yes-only array of short generated love notes (distinct from the initial loveNotes) to centralized content for progressive reveal.

Implement progressive reveal after Yes (timer-driven state that shows one additional note every few hundred milliseconds) and render the notes in a wrap/stack layout that avoids overlapping critical content on mobile. Ensure no persistence is introduced so refresh resets to pre-Yes. Verify any shadcn/ui composition usage instructions before implementing.
Add lightweight CSS keyframes/utility classes for gentle romantic note animations (e.g., fade-in + subtle upward float) to support progressive note appearance without adding new libraries.

All user-visible UI strings used for the proposal, buttons, notes, and letter are in English.
